skill.name: python-fastapi
skill.description: Python FastAPI development with uv package manager, modular project structure, SQLAlchemy ORM, and production-ready patterns.
skill.summary: Python FastAPI development with uv package manager, modular project structure, SQLAlchemy ORM, and p...
skill.author: 0xkynz

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with code examples. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no external command execution. Contains standard FastAPI development patterns and best practices.

content.user_title: Build production-ready Python APIs with FastAPI
content.value_statement: Creating Python APIs requires understanding FastAPI patterns, async database access, and proper project structure. This skill provides expert patterns for building scalable APIs with modern Python tools.
actual_capabilities: Generate FastAPI project structure with modular architecture
Create async SQLAlchemy models and repository patterns
Implement dependency injection with FastAPI Depends
Configure Pydantic v2 schemas for request validation
limitations: Does not deploy or host FastAPI applications
Does not configure production reverse proxies
Does not set up CI/CD pipelines
Does not provide database hosting services

use_cases.title: Build REST APIs
use_cases.description: Create scalable REST APIs with async Python, proper validation, and clean architecture patterns.

use_cases.title: Add backend to web apps
use_cases.description: Develop fast Python backends with async database access for web applications.

use_cases.title: Containerize Python APIs
use_cases.description: Structure FastAPI projects for container deployment with proper configuration management.

prompt_templates.title: New FastAPI project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new FastAPI project structure with feature-based modular architecture. Include user authentication endpoints, SQLAlchemy async models, and Pydantic v2 validation schemas.

prompt_templates.title: Add new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new feature module to my FastAPI project with CRUD endpoints, repository pattern, service layer, and proper dependency injection.

prompt_templates.title: Database migrations
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure Alembic for async SQLAlchemy migrations in my FastAPI project. Include migration environment setup and sample migration script.

prompt_templates.title: Write tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write pytest async test cases for my FastAPI endpoints using httpx AsyncClient and in-memory SQLite database.

output_examples.input: Create a FastAPI project with user authentication and items CRUD
output: Models: User with email, hashed_password, is_active fields
Schemas: UserCreate, UserResponse, UserUpdate with Pydantic validation
Services: UserService with create, get, list, update methods
Repositories: UserRepository with async database operations
API endpoints: GET /users, POST /users, GET /users/{id}, PATCH /users/{id}
Authentication router with JWT token generation
Tests: conftest.py with async client fixture

best_practices: Use async/await throughout for non-blocking database operations
Separate concerns with routes, services, and repository layers
Validate all input with Pydantic v2 schemas before processing
Use FastAPI dependency injection for clean testability
anti_patterns: Do not put business logic directly in API route handlers
Do not use synchronous database calls in async FastAPI endpoints
Do not commit secrets or credentials to version control
Do not disable validation in production for convenience

faq.question: What Python version is required?
faq.answer: FastAPI with these patterns requires Python 3.12 or newer for best async support.

faq.question: Does this support PostgreSQL and SQLite?
faq.answer: Yes. Use asyncpg for PostgreSQL production and aiosqlite for in-memory testing.

faq.question: Can I use this with Docker containers?
faq.answer: The project structure works well with Docker. Add a Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation skill that provides patterns. No data is stored or transmitted.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot startup errors?
faq.answer: Check your database URL format, ensure database is running, and verify all environment variables are set.

faq.question: How is this different from Flask or Django?
faq.answer: FastAPI offers async support, automatic OpenAPI documentation, and Pydantic validation out of the box.
